intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. triradiatum, commonly known as the three-rayed bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbels of small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along streambanks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, greenish-yellow fruits that disperse by wind. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
